alert.note: Alert for North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 4:43PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Lincoln County through 530 PM MDT... At 442 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles south of Genoa, or 10 miles east of Limon. This storm was nearly stationary. Another strong thunderstorm was located northwest of Genoa, or just northeast of Limon, also showing little movement. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, half inch hail, and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding of low lying areas possible. Locations impacted include... Hugo and Genoa. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County
